alert.note: Alert for Berks; Chester (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 30 at 8:14PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of east central Pennsylvania...and southeast Pennsylvania...including the following counties...in east central Pennsylvania...Berks. In southeast Pennsylvania...Chester. * WHEN...Until 1115 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 812 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain with some embedded thunderstorms. Overflowing poor drainage areas and small creeks and streams will cause minor flooding across portions of the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen over the past few hours, with an additional 1 to 2 inches possible through 11 PM this evening. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Reading, Coatesville, Wyomissing, Birdsboro, Oxford, Hamburg, Fleetwood, Sinking Spring, Laureldale, Parkesburg, West Grove, and Wernersville. - This includes the following highways... Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 296 and 303. Interstate 78 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 21 and 40. Interstate 176 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 1 and 11. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
